title: I rewatched all of the Sopranos over a month and I loved it

content.subheading: Is it still the best tv-series ever?

content.content: I mostly enjoy Murakami, and I enjoyed reading this book over the summer.

content.subheading: The game I constantly keep replaying the first few hours of
content.content: I've had this game since it first released back in 2016. Every time there's an update, I'll start a new game, play for 10-ish hours in total, then walk away until the next update. Next update I'll come back, forget what my character was doing last time and generally have a hard time getting back into it, and start over. Then I'll play for another 10-ish hours, walk away, and the cycle repeats.

content.subheading: or, Notes from a Dead House. Translations differ
content.content: I am under no illusion that I can have anything new or useful to say about Dostoevsky, so I'll just say that he is considered a master of literature for good reasons.

content.subheading: I was thinking about things that should go on the 'good' list
content.content: And Preacher seems like an obvious choice in the 'comics' category. An epic modernist western about a preacher who goes on the hunt to find God and hold him accountable for his actions towards humanity. A series that has stayed with me for years after I last read it.

title: I'm still thinking about the Sopranos

content.content: This is just mock data, otherwise I'd feel compelled to spend a few days trying to actually come up with a good post about how spectacularly great this series is. James Gandolfini's performance alone; he embodies his role in a way no other actor in a tv-series has, that I can think of.  If for some reason you've never watched the Sopranos, you really should. If you haven't seen it in a while you should re-watch it. I spent a month and a half travelling this semester, and I had a really good time, and beginning watching the Sopranos during it was the highlight of it all.
